headline: Cisco Earnings, Jobs Report, CPI Data: Still to Come This Week
summary: This week brings a deluge of economic indicators, particularly jobs and inflation reports, which were stalled by the recent government closure. Another shutdown may loom if Congress doesn't reach a deal on immigration enforcement.

headline: Kraft Heinz tumbles 7% as company pauses split, issues weak guidance
summary: Investing.com - Kraft Heinz Co. (NASDAQ:KHC) shares tumbled 7% on Wednesday after the food giant announced it would pause its planned company separation and issued disappointing 2026 guidance that fell short of analyst expectations.

content.title: Kraft Heinz tumbles 7% as company pauses split, issues weak guidance

headline: Kraft Heinz shares tumble as 2026 guidance falls short
summary: Investing.com -- Kraft Heinz (NASDAQ:KHC) shares fell 6.3% on Wednesday after the food giant reported better-than-expected fourth quarter earnings but issued disappointing guidance for fiscal year 2026, including a planned $600 million investment to revitalize growth.

content.title: Kraft Heinz shares tumble as 2026 guidance falls short
content.summary: Investing.com -- Kraft Heinz (NASDAQ:KHC) shares fell 6.3% on Wednesday after the food giant reported better-than-expected fourth quarter earnings but issued disappointing guidance for fiscal year 2026, including a planned $600 million investment to revitalize growth.

headline: Kraft Heinz Pauses Plan to Split Into Two Companies
summary: Kraft Heinz  is pumping the breaks on its breakup plan.  “Since joining the company, I have seen that the opportunity is larger than I expected and that many of our challenges are fixable,” said  Steve Cahillane,  Kraft Heinz’s chief executive, who took over leadership of the company Jan. 1.  Cahillane said that his top priority is returning the business to profitable growth and that the company would no longer pursue a split this year.

content.title: Kraft Heinz Pauses Plan to Split Into Two Companies
content.summary: Kraft Heinz  is pumping the breaks on its breakup plan.  “Since joining the company, I have seen that the opportunity is larger than I expected and that many of our challenges are fixable,” said  Steve Cahillane,  Kraft Heinz’s chief executive, who took over leadership of the company Jan. 1.  Cahillane said that his top priority is returning the business to profitable growth and that the company would no longer pursue a split this year.

headline: Kraft Heinz (NASDAQ:KHC) Posts Q4 CY2025 Sales In Line With Estimates But Stock Drops
summary: Packaged foods company Kraft Heinz (NASDAQ:KHC) met Wall Street’s revenue expectations in Q4 CY2025, but sales fell by 3.4% year on year to $6.35 billion. Its non-GAAP profit of $0.67 per share was 9.1% above analysts’ consensus estimates.

content.title: Kraft Heinz (NASDAQ:KHC) Posts Q4 CY2025 Sales In Line With Estimates But Stock Drops
content.summary: Packaged foods company Kraft Heinz (NASDAQ:KHC) met Wall Street’s revenue expectations in Q4 CY2025, but sales fell by 3.4% year on year to $6.35 billion. Its non-GAAP profit of $0.67 per share was 9.1% above analysts’ consensus estimates.

headline: Kraft Heinz: Q4 Earnings Snapshot
summary: PITTSBURGH (AP) — The Kraft Heinz Company (KHC) on Wednesday reported fourth-quarter net income of $651 million. The Pittsburgh-based company said it had net income of 55 cents per share. Earnings, adjusted for non-recurring costs, came to 67 cents per share.

content.title: Kraft Heinz: Q4 Earnings Snapshot
content.summary: PITTSBURGH (AP) — The Kraft Heinz Company (KHC) on Wednesday reported fourth-quarter net income of $651 million. The Pittsburgh-based company said it had net income of 55 cents per share. Earnings, adjusted for non-recurring costs, came to 67 cents per share.

headline: The Kraft Heinz Company Declares Regular Quarterly Dividend of $0.40 Per Share
summary: PITTSBURGH & CHICAGO, February 11, 2026--The Kraft Heinz Company (Nasdaq: KHC) announced today that the Company’s Board of Directors declared a regular quarterly dividend of $0.40 per share of common stock payable on March 27, 2026, to stockholders of record as of March 6, 2026.

content.title: The Kraft Heinz Company Declares Regular Quarterly Dividend of $0.40 Per Share
content.summary: PITTSBURGH & CHICAGO, February 11, 2026--The Kraft Heinz Company (Nasdaq: KHC) announced today that the Company’s Board of Directors declared a regular quarterly dividend of $0.40 per share of common stock payable on March 27, 2026, to stockholders of record as of March 6, 2026.

headline: Kraft Heinz Reports Fourth Quarter and Full Year 2025 Results
summary: PITTSBURGH & CHICAGO, February 11, 2026--The Kraft Heinz Company (Nasdaq: KHC) ("Kraft Heinz" or the "Company") today reported financial results for the fourth quarter and full year 2025 and introduced its 2026 operating plan.

content.title: Kraft Heinz Reports Fourth Quarter and Full Year 2025 Results
content.summary: PITTSBURGH & CHICAGO, February 11, 2026--The Kraft Heinz Company (Nasdaq: KHC) ("Kraft Heinz" or the "Company") today reported financial results for the fourth quarter and full year 2025 and introduced its 2026 operating plan.

headline: Ancora to oppose WBD-Netflix deal, Kraft Heinz halts split plans
summary: Morning Brief Host Julie Hyman and Yahoo Finance Markets and Data Editor Jared Blikre track several of the day's top trending stock tickers, including the Wall Street Journal reporting that activist investor Ancora is positioned to oppose a potential deal between Warner Bros. Discovery (WBD) and Netfix (NFLX), Kraft Heinz (KHC) putting a pause on its plans to spin-off a segment of the food company, and the US Food and Drug Administration (FDA) refusing to review Moderna's (MRNA) new flu vaccine. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Morning Brief.

headline: Kraft Heinz pauses plans to split into 2 companies, says its problems are 'fixable'
summary: Kraft Heinz said Wednesday it's pausing its plans to split into two companies.  Steve Cahillane, a former Kellogg Co. chief who became CEO of Kraft Heinz on Jan. 1, said he wants to ensure that all of the company's resources are focused on profitable growth.  The company's shares dropped 5.2% in early trading Wednesday as Kraft Heinz reported lower quarterly and annual results.

content.title: Kraft Heinz pauses plans to split into 2 companies, says its problems are 'fixable'
content.summary: Kraft Heinz said Wednesday it's pausing its plans to split into two companies.  Steve Cahillane, a former Kellogg Co. chief who became CEO of Kraft Heinz on Jan. 1, said he wants to ensure that all of the company's resources are focused on profitable growth.  The company's shares dropped 5.2% in early trading Wednesday as Kraft Heinz reported lower quarterly and annual results.

headline: Kraft Heinz Is Rethinking a Separation. The Stock Is Tumbling.
summary: Shares of  Kraft Heinz  tumbled Wednesday as the packaged-food giant announced it would pause a planned split into two companies and issued a dim 2026 forecast.  Kraft Heinz  had planned to divide its faster-growing brands like Heinz and Philadelphia cream cheese into an independent company called Global Taste Elevation, while a separate company North American Grocery would own brands facing bigger challenges.  New CEO Steve Cahillane suspended that plan Wednesday.

content.title: Kraft Heinz Is Rethinking a Separation. The Stock Is Tumbling.
content.summary: Shares of  Kraft Heinz  tumbled Wednesday as the packaged-food giant announced it would pause a planned split into two companies and issued a dim 2026 forecast.  Kraft Heinz  had planned to divide its faster-growing brands like Heinz and Philadelphia cream cheese into an independent company called Global Taste Elevation, while a separate company North American Grocery would own brands facing bigger challenges.  New CEO Steve Cahillane suspended that plan Wednesday.

headline: Ford, Lyft, Kraft Heinz, Hasbro, Mattel: Earnings Roundup
summary: US stock futures (ES=F, NQ=F, YM=F) are rising in Wednesday's pre-market trading after the January jobs report saw the US economy grow by 130,000 non-farm payrolls last month, double the job growth expected by economists. Companies like Ford (F), Lyft (LYFT), Kraft Heinz (KHC), Hasbro (HAS), and Mattel (MAT) also reported their latest earnings results amid all this fresh economic news. Morning Brief Host Julie Hyman dives into the latest earnings results from top companies. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Morning Brief.

headline: Kraft Heinz Split Reshapes Sauces And Grocery Future For Investors
summary: Kraft Heinz (NasdaqGS:KHC) announced a major split of its global sauces division and North American grocery business. The restructuring plan separates ketchup, condiments and international sauces from the company’s core North American packaged foods portfolio. The move comes as Kraft Heinz continues to face operational challenges and competitive pressure across key categories. Kraft Heinz, the owner of brands such as Heinz ketchup and Kraft macaroni and cheese, sits at the intersection of...

headline: Kraft Heinz Is Rethinking a Separation. The Stock Is Falling.
summary: Shares of  Kraft Heinz  declined Wednesday as the packaged-food giant announced it would pause a planned split into two companies and issued a dim 2026 forecast.  Kraft Heinz  had planned to divide its faster-growing brands like Heinz and Philadelphia cream cheese into an independent company called Global Taste Elevation, while a separate company North American Grocery would own brands facing bigger challenges.  New CEO Steve Cahillane suspended that plan Wednesday.

Kraft Heinz  had planned to divide its faster-growing brands like Heinz and Philadelphia cream cheese into an independent company called Global Taste Elevation, while a separate company North American Grocery would own brands facing bigger challenges.  New CEO Steve Cahillane suspended that plan Wednesday.

headline: Kraft Heinz Just Shocked Investors With a Massive Pivot
summary: Kraft Heinz Co (NASDAQ: KHC) delivered mixed fourth-quarter results on February 11, 2026, beating earnings expectations while missing on revenue. However, the bigger story was CEO Steve Cahillane’s decision to halt the planned separation and commit $600 million to a turnaround effort. Shares fell roughly 7% in premarket trading as investors digested the strategic pivot ... Kraft Heinz Just Shocked Investors With a Massive Pivot

headline: Kraft Heinz’s CEO Signed On for a Breakup. Now He Has a Plan to Keep It Together.
summary: Kraft Heinz  is pumping the brakes on its breakup plan—and its new chief executive needs to figure out how to get the food giant growing again.  Instead, CEO  Steve Cahillane  said that he will focus on returning the business to growth in 2027, investing hundreds of millions of dollars in new marketing and product-development efforts.  “Since joining the company, I have seen that the opportunity is larger than I expected and that many of our challenges are fixable,” said Cahillane, who took over leadership of the company Jan. 1.

content.title: Kraft Heinz’s CEO Signed On for a Breakup. Now He Has a Plan to Keep It Together.
content.summary: Kraft Heinz  is pumping the brakes on its breakup plan—and its new chief executive needs to figure out how to get the food giant growing again.  Instead, CEO  Steve Cahillane  said that he will focus on returning the business to growth in 2027, investing hundreds of millions of dollars in new marketing and product-development efforts.  “Since joining the company, I have seen that the opportunity is larger than I expected and that many of our challenges are fixable,” said Cahillane, who took over leadership of the company Jan. 1.
